data.title: Best in town
data.text:
Been going here since they opened love this place great prices and great food wonderful waitresses 
Best salsa also

data.title: Great dining experience
data.text: The food is very good,  the service is excellent,  and there is ample parking. The dining area is clean so are the bathrooms.  Very authentic Mexican faire.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Wife and I went there for lunch. Good selection and good seating. Good drink selection. The parking is so so.

data.title: Best Chicken tacos in town!
data.text: The food is fresh and the service is good. Overall is very good but to me the chicken tacos are exceptionally good.

data.title: Consistent Mexican cuisine
data.text: Their food is consistent on multiple visits.  The service is pretty good.  Normally there is plenty of street parking available.

data.title: Consistently good!
data.text: I have grown up with the Tio Pepe family; I would have died of malnutrition had I not ever eaten at one of their restaurants. I have never gone home hungry or broke and I cannot remember a time in 40 years where I was sorry to have eaten at Tio Pepe's; unless of course it is because I ate too much!

data.title: good food but the servers were somewhat unattentative.
data.text: I have always enjoyed Tio Pepe's but after not going there for a year I decided to stop in. There were 4 people working that I saw and 3 were sitting at a table talking. The 4th was walking around doing??? I finally got the attention of one of the 3 and got a menu..then she went back and sat back down. I decided it was just best to go to Taco Bell as I only have a short 1 hour lunch.

data.title: My little secret place.....
data.text: I really enjoy Tio Pepe's II. The atmosphere and decor leave much to be desired, but that is not why I go.....we go for the food. Good food at good prices plain and simple. Tio's is on the top of my list for its food. I love their refried beans and mole sauce or (gravy) is awesome! People have different palate's and whether or not you like a certain mexican restaurant is very subjective depending on your palate. You will find that they are pretty consistent with the quality of their food. I enjoy the tacos, enchiladas, tostadas and quesadillas as well as their beans and rice. Its not in the greatest part of town....but we have never had problems and their prices are worth the extra drive. Enjoy!

data.title: Good standby.
data.text: I've been coming to Tio's, as I call it, for over 20 years and it has been consistently good.  Their chicken tacos, guacamole tostadas, chile rellenos plus their beans and rice are really good, in my humble opinion.  I also love their pork soup; nice and spicy.  One more thing, their salsa is super!

data.title: Very Good
data.text: The food here is very good, and the service is friendly and fast.  I can go  here for lunch and get back to work in no time...the only problem is I fell like I need a nap after, but, that is not their fault  :-)

data.title: Reasonably priced, filling, and darn it, the food is good too!
data.text: The food is always the same, which is hard to do. It seems in many restaurants that the food changes when the staff does, but in my vast experience Tio Pepe's food is always the same. It is reasonably priced, filling and darn it, the food is good too! What more could you ask for when you are hungry and do not want to spend a lot of money and do not want to make a mess in your kitchen.

data.title: Absolutely Love This Place!
data.text: We've been a loyal customer of Tio Pepe's for 30 years!  It's a family business and their food is always great!  We love the gravy they give to go with their chips!  We usually order the chicken quesadilla and chicken enchiladas. I love their rice!!  Highly recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Food is good but was recently charged a dollar when I asked for some sour cream to GO WITH my tacos ... I was surprised when I got the bill because I was not told that it would cost me.  Very disappointed.  I find this to be greedy, I'm already paying a good price for the meal.

data.title: Average to good Mexican food.
data.text:
Overall I like this place, but their food is inconsistent. 

If you dine in they will bring you chips/salsa.   If you want to take it to go they want to charge $4 just for the chips!   Insane....

Their gravy is inconsistent.   Some days its delicious and would make a dirty shoe taste great.  Other days it tastes like it has been watered down.

The tamale lunch is delicious when the gravy is good.   They need to do a better job of picking the fat off when shredding pork.   On multiple occasions my tamale had very little meat- it was mostly filled w/ nasty pork fat.    Some days the tamale doesn't have adequate seasoning on the meat.

Service is fine.    Prefer this place to Cancun.

data.title: Better than the last tio pepe's
data.text: Well, they are back.  Third time is a charm. Their food is much better than last time when they were on March lane.  The salsa no longer tastes like a tin can, and may actually be fresh.  Nice improvements.   Staff could use some people skills.

data.title: Don't let the neighborhood scare you off
data.text: The food is phenomonal here.  We love going to eat here.  The restaurant is family-owned and operated.  They know us by name because we've been there so many times.  The waitresses always ask how my mom is.  I've never had a bad meal or bad service here.  Not once.
